page.title: 18HOUSING IN GATESHEAD
page.content: There are 3931{council houses,}217 pre-war houses and a block of{colliery {houses}in{Leam Lane.} The last were built in 1970. Leam Lane has the largest number of{privately owned {houses}in Gateshead. 2900 houses have central heating and back and front gardens. These houses have to be passed by the{Parker Morris Standard. { }In{Springwell Estate}there are 951 {council houses.} The first houses were built in 1950 and the most recent completed in 1978. 600 houses have central heating and back and front gardens. There are 72 dwellings of three storey{flats,}which are popular with elderly people. Since 1980 sixteen houses have been bought by their tenants. Tenants in the council houses must pay their{rent}either at the Post Office or housing office as they do not have a rent collector.
